name: Trust
summary: Vote who you think is good instead of who is bad. Whoever gets voted becomes a leader and get a free kill as well as immunity from death during the night. However, they will convert back after 1 night. Be cautious when you vote, because bad guys get empowered as well when voted. If you vote a target corrupted by the boycotter, that player will die instead of becaming leader.
author: Obey to Kyubey

variables.inspectz: Your inspect: ~Self~, has -999 as voteshield tonight. They have been probably blocked by the Boycotters otherwise they are a Nice Guy, a Lackey or a Poor Guy!
variables.inspect0: Your inspect: ~Self~, will die if gets elected as Leader tonight. They have been probably corrupted by the Boycotters or they are a Fugitive.
variables.inspect+: Your inspect: ~Self~, has +9999 as voteshield tonight. They will be probably elected as Leader today.

sides.winmsg: ±Incubator: The trust that you have given to your people has been repaid. Congratulations ~Players~
±Incubator: Salute oh great ~Players~! We all kneel before your power.
±Incubator: Oh this village is so funny, ~Players~ now can go away happy for the madness that now rules this place.
±Incubator: We live to sin and sin exists because we live in it. Good Job ~Players~
±Incubator: Trust is for toddlers. Everyone is ready to trick and betray us. ~Players~ can prove it.

roles.info: A Detective able to discover if their targets has a voteshield and if their target is able to became a Leader tonight. If someone tries to boycott Detective using /corrupt or /block: they will be discovered by him. When Detective is a Leader: they will evade night-kill actions 50% of the time. Sided with Innocents.
roles.help: You are the one on charge to track down the boycotters' gang and destroy their plans. Every Night use /inspect to discover if your target has a vote-shield or if they are able to be a Leader this night. The first time that you get boycotted by a /corrupt or /block command: you will discover one of the culprits. During every vote phase you and the others citizens can decide who will be the village Leader. Be cautious not to elect a Sinner or a Boycotter to Leader. P.S. If you became a Leader your immunity to kills will fail 50% of the time so be cautious!

roles.info: Starting Night 2, can kill 1 person every 2 nights or protect-safeguard anyone that it's not a leader every 2 nights. If voted they will die. Sided with the innocents.
roles.help: To serve and protect it's your motto. After the first night you can /protect another player from any possible bad action, or , /arrest a player that you find suspicious. Both this abilities don't work on leaders and they will need to wait 2 turns before to be used again.
roles.help2: P.S. Remember that you don't make the law, you execute it. Which means that if you get voted: instead to become a leader you will be arrested

Sinners' normal attacks cannot harm you, only Leaders' abilities and other few roles can kill you. The boycotters can't convert you. If you get voted again, you will became even more powerful. P.S. Do not kill too early or the others will suspect you. Use /tt to teamTalk with your partners.
roles.help2: You can /kill thrice per night and you have 3 votes
roles.info: +3  as vote, can kill two times during the night, can be killed only by a Leader(of any type), can't be converted by the boycotter. If he get voted he will became even more powerful. Sided with Dictator.

roles.info: The Fearless Villager thinks to be a normal villager until they are elected as village's Leaders. Every time that Fearless Villager becomes a leader they will receive a non revealing daykill too, to use whenever they want. As drawback when they are leader they can still be killed and boycotted, so it should be better to use their daykill wisely to not reveal themselves. Sided with the innocents.
roles.help: Oooh, look what we have here! It seems that the village has acquired a Fearless Leader tonight. You can now kill the Sinners with /justice during the night! You can even use /justice during the day once every time that you get elected as Leader. After the night ends, you will return to being a Fearless Villager. Sadly you can still be boycotted or killed even now that you have become a Leader, so use your daykills wisely so that no one will suspect that you are a Fearless Villager.

roles.info: The Judge can poison any possible type of leader, that leader will die the same night. The Judge vote is 0. Sided with the Innocents. Sided with the Innocents
roles.help: Congratulations! The village has elected you as its new leader. You can now kill the Sinners with /justice during the night! You are the Leader right now, so you cannot /judge tonight. After the night ends, you will return to being a Judge. P.s. you are immune to night kills

roles.info: Detective Leader can kill someone during the night and is immune to night kills 50% of the times, at the end of the night he will return to be a normal Detective. Sided with Innocents
roles.help: Congratulation the village has elected you as his new leader, now kill your enemies with /justice and /inspect another target during the night, after the night ends you will return to be a normal Detective. P.s. you have a 50% chance to evade night-kills!

lynchmsg: ±Incubator: 'Oops! Some bureaucratic error happened and ~Player~ (~Role~) was transported to a forced-labour camp!

tips.Leaders: 90% of the roles if voted instead to die will become an unkillable Leader for one night with all their previous abilities plus an extra unstoppable night-kill
tips.Village: The village side should try to vote Villagers, Crazy Villagers or Fearless Villagers, because the power roles cannot be elected Leaders or they have some drawbacks when elected.
tips.Boycotters: Anyone converted by a Boycotter cannot be elected as a Leader permanently only who is already a Leader is immune from the Boycotter.
tips.Saboteurs: As the Boycotter the Saboteur can convert and make ineligible as Leaders their targets but only for one turn, but at the same time Saboteur can convert even Leader roles.

1/09/2013: Some grammar fixes added, thanks Fuzzysqrl for the help.
5/09/2013: Added fugitive(vaati-like role) and crazy villager(miller-bomb).
31/01/2014: Theme expanded into 41 players games. Added Fearless Villager, Twin, Judge, Rich Guy,Lackey, Sniper, Poisoner, Accomplice, Follower, Detective, Cop, Coyote and Trickster
